member.name: P:Simplexcel.CellCollection.RowCount
member.summary: How many Rows are in the sheet? (This counts the maximum row index, so empty rows are counted if they are followed by another row)

member.name: P:Simplexcel.CellCollection.ColumnCount
member.summary: How many Columns are in the sheet? (This counts the rightmost column, so empty columns are counted if they are followed by another column)

member.name: P:Simplexcel.CellCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Get the cell with the given cell reference, e.g. Get the cell "A1". May return NULL.
member.returns: The Cell, or NULL of the Cell hasn't been created yet.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.CellCollection.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the cell with the given zero based row and column, e.g. [0,0] returns the A1 cell. May return NULL.
member.returns: The Cell, or NULL of the Cell hasn't been created yet.

member.name: T:Simplexcel.CellType
member.summary: The Type of a Cell, important for handling the values corrently (e.g., Excel not converting long numbers into scientific notation or removing leading zeroes)

member.name: F:Simplexcel.CellType.Text
member.summary: Cell contains text, so use it exactly as specified

member.name: F:Simplexcel.CellType.Number
member.summary: Cell contains a number (may strip leading zeroes but sorts properly)

member.name: F:Simplexcel.CellType.Date
member.summary: Cell contains a date, must be greater than 01/01/0100

member.name: P:Simplexcel.GradientStop.Position
member.summary: The position indicated here indicates the point where the color is pure.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.GradientStop.Color
member.summary: The pure color of this Gradient Stop

member.name: T:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: The Horizontal Alignment of content within a Cell

member.name: F:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign.None
member.summary: No specific alignment, use Excel's default

member.name: F:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign.General
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is general-aligned. Text data is left-aligned. Numbers, dates, and times are rightaligned. Boolean types are centered. Changing the alignment does not change the type of data.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign.Left
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is left-aligned, even in Right-to-Left mode.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign.Center
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is centered, meaning the text is centered across the cell.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign.Right
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is right-aligned, meaning that cell contents are aligned at the right edge of the cell, even in Right-to-Left mode.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.HorizontalAlign.Justify
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is justified (flush left and right). For each line of text, aligns each line of the wrapped text in a cell to the right and left (except the last line). If no single line of text wraps in the cell, then the text is not justified.

member.name: T:Simplexcel.IgnoredError
member.summary: Information about Errors that are being ignored in a cell

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.NumberStoredAsText
member.summary: Ignore errors when numbers are formatted as text or are preceded by an apostrophe.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.CalculatedColumn
member.summary: Ignore errors when cells contain a value different from a calculated column formula. In other words, for a calculated column, a cell in that column is considered to have an error if its formula is different from the calculated column formula, or doesn't contain a formula at all.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.EmptyCellReference
member.summary: Ignore errors when formulas refer to empty cells

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.EvalError
member.summary: Ignore errors when cells contain formulas that result in an error.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.Formula
member.summary: Ignore errors when a formula in a region of your worksheet differs from other formulas in the same region.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.FormulaRange
member.summary: Ignore errors when formulas omit certain cells in a region.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.ListDataValidation
member.summary: Ignore errors when a cell's value in a Table does not comply with the Data Validation rules specified.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.TwoDigitTextYear
member.summary: Ignore errors when formulas contain text formatted cells with years represented as 2 digits.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.UnlockedFormula
member.summary: Ignore errors when unlocked cells contain formulas.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.IsDifferentFromDefault
member.summary: Is this instance different from the default (does it need an ignoredError element?)

member.name: M:Simplexcel.IgnoredError.GetHashCode
member.summary: Get the HashCode for this instance, which is a unique combination based on the boolean properties

member.summary: The Background Color of the Fill. (No effect if is )

member.summary: Check whether the objects and are Equal.

member.name: M:Simplexcel.PatternFill.op_Inequality(Simplexcel.PatternFill,Simplexcel.PatternFill)
member.summary: Check whether the objects and are not Equal.

member.name: T:Simplexcel.PatternType
member.summary: The Type of the pattern in a .

member.name: T:Simplexcel.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The Vertical Alignment of content within a Cell

member.name: F:Simplexcel.VerticalAlign.None
member.summary: No specific alignment, use Excel's default

member.name: F:Simplexcel.VerticalAlign.Middle
member.summary: The vertical alignment is centered across the height of the cell.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.VerticalAlign.Justify
member.summary:
When text direction is horizontal: the vertical alignment of lines of text is distributed vertically, where each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the height of the cell, with flush top and bottom margins.
When text direction is vertical: similar behavior as horizontal justification. The alignment is justified (flush top and bottom in this case). For each line of text, each line of the wrapped text in a cell is aligned to the top and bottom (except the last line). If no single line of text wraps in the cell, then the text is not justified.

member.name: T:Simplexcel.XlsxColumnAttribute
member.summary: Used with or , allows setting how object properties are handled.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.XlsxColumnAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the Column, used as the Header row. If this is NULL, the Property Name will be used. If this is an Empty string, then no text will be in the Cell header.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.XlsxColumnAttribute.ColumnIndex
member.summary:
The Index of the Column, e.g., "0" for "A". If there are Columns with and without an Index, the columns without an Index will be added after the last column with an Index.
It is recommended that either all object properties or none specify Column Indexes

member.name: T:Simplexcel.LargeNumberHandlingMode
member.summary:
Excel doesn't want to display large numbers (more than 11 digits) properly: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2643223/long-numbers-are-displayed-incorrectly-in-excel
This decides how to handle larger numbers. See and for the actual limits.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.LargeNumberHandlingMode.StoreAsText
member.summary: Force the number to be stored as Text (Default)

member.name: F:Simplexcel.LargeNumberHandlingMode.None
member.summary: Do not do anything different, and store numbers as-is. This may cause Excel to truncate the number. This was the behavior before Simplexcel Version 2.1.0.

member.name: T:Simplexcel.PageBreak
member.summary: The brk element, for Page Breaks

member.name: P:Simplexcel.PageBreak.Id
member.summary: Zero-based row or column Id of the page break. Breaks occur above the specified row and left of the specified column.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.PageBreak.IsManualBreak
member.summary: Manual Break flag. true means the break is a manually inserted break.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.PageBreak.Max
P:Simplexcel.PageBreak.Min
P:Simplexcel.PageBreak.IsPivotCreatedPageBreak
member.summary: Flag indicating that a PivotTable created this break.

member.name: M:Simplexcel.Worksheet.FreezeTopRow

member.name: M:Simplexcel.Worksheet.FreezeLeftColumn

member.summary: Freezes rows at the top and columns on the left.

The number of columns to freeze.

member.name: M:Simplexcel.Worksheet.FromData``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Create Worksheet with the provided data.
Will use the Object Property Names as Column Headers (First Row) and then populate the cells with data. You can use and to control the output.
member.param: The data, can be empty or null
If true, the Column info for the given type is being cached in memory

member.name: M:Simplexcel.Worksheet.Populate``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Populate Worksheet with the provided data.
Will use the Object Property Names as Column Headers (First Row) and then populate the cells with data. You can use and to control the output.
member.param: The data, can be empty or null
If true, the Column info for the given type is being cached in memory

member.name: P:Simplexcel.Pane.XSplit
member.summary: Horizontal position of the split, in 1/20th of a point; 0 (zero) if none. If the pane is frozen, this value indicates the number of columns visible in the top pane.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.Pane.YSplit
member.summary: Vertical position of the split, in 1/20th of a point; 0 (zero) if none. If the pane is frozen, this value indicates the number of rows visible in the left pane

member.name: P:Simplexcel.Pane.State
member.summary: Indicates whether the pane has horizontal / vertical splits, and whether those splits are frozen.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.Pane.TopLeftCell
member.summary: Location of the top left visible cell in the bottom right pane (when in Left-To-Right mode)

member.name: T:Simplexcel.Panes
member.summary: Defines the names of the four possible panes into which the view of a workbook in the application can be split.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.Panes.BottomRight
member.summary: Bottom right pane, when both vertical and horizontal splits are applied.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.Panes.TopRight
member.summary:
Top right pane, when both vertical and horizontal splits are applied.
This value is also used when only a vertical split has been applied, dividing the pane into right and left regions. In that case, this value specifies the right pane.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.Panes.BottomLeft
member.summary:
Bottom left pane, when both vertical and horizontal splits are applied.
This value is also used when only a horizontal split has been applied, dividing the pane into upper and lower regions. In that case, this value specifies the bottom pane

member.name: F:Simplexcel.Panes.TopLeft
member.summary:
Top left pane, when both vertical and horizontal splits are applied.
This value is also used when only a horizontal split has been applied, dividing the pane into upper and lower regions. In that case, this value specifies the top pane.
This value is also used when only a vertical split has been applied, dividing the pane into right and left regions. In that case, this value specifies the left pane

member.name: F:Simplexcel.PaneState.Split
member.summary: Panes are split, but not frozen. In this state, the split bars are adjustable by the user.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.PaneState.Frozen
member.summary: Panes are frozen, but were not split being frozen. In this state, when the panes are unfrozen again, a single pane results, with no split.

member.name: F:Simplexcel.PaneState.FrozenSplit
member.summary: Panes are frozen and were split before being frozen. In this state, when the panes are unfrozen again, the split remains, but is adjustable.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.Selection.ActivePane
member.summary: The pane to which this selection belongs.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.Selection.ActiveCell
member.summary: Location of the active cell. E.g., "A1"

member.name: T:Simplexcel.SheetView
member.summary:
A single sheet view definition. When more than one sheet view is defined in the file, it means that when opening the workbook, each sheet view corresponds to a separate window within the spreadsheet application, where each window is showing the particular sheet containing the same workbookViewId value, the last sheetView definition is loaded, and the others are discarded.
When multiple windows are viewing the same sheet, multiple sheetView elements (with corresponding workbookView entries) are saved.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.SheetView.TabSelected
member.summary: Flag indicating whether this sheet is selected. When only 1 sheet is selected and active, this value should be in synch with the activeTab value. In case of a conflict, the Start Part setting wins and sets the active sheet tab. Multiple sheets can be selected, but only one sheet shall be active at one time.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.SheetView.ShowRuler
member.summary: Show the ruler in page layout view

member.name: P:Simplexcel.SheetView.WorkbookViewId
member.summary: Zero-based index of this workbook view, pointing to a workbookView element in the bookViews collection.

member.name: P:Simplexcel.SheetView.Pane
member.summary: The pane that this SheetView applies to

member.name: M:Simplexcel.SheetView.AddSelection(Simplexcel.Selection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add the given selection to the SheetView
member.param: If true, will throw an if there is already a selection with the same . If false, overwrite the previous selection for that pane.

member.summary: Save a workbook to a MemoryStream
member.exception: Thrown if there are no sheets in the workbook.

member.name: T:Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.XlsxWriter.XlsxWriterInternal
member.summary:
This does the actual writing by manually creating the XML according to ECMA-376, 3rd Edition, Part 1's SpreadsheetML.
Note that in many cases, the order of elements in an XML file matters!

member.name: M:Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.XlsxWriter.XlsxWriterInternal.ExtractWorkbookSpecialXmlParts(Simplexcel.Workbook,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.XlsxCellStyle}@,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{Simplexcel.Worksheet,Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.XlsxIgnoredErrorCollection}@)
member.summary: Extract certain parts of the workbook that need special handling.
member.remarks: I don't want to loop over cells over and over again, so this is a way to run over all cells once and extract everything needed.
member.param: All unique Styles throughout the workbook
Any ignored errors. Key is the Worksheet, and the inner dictionary key is the cell range

member.name: M:Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.XlsxWriter.XlsxWriterInternal.CreateCoreFileProperties(Simplexcel.Workbook,Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.RelationshipCounter)
member.summary: Generated the docProps/core.xml which contains author, creation date etc.

member.summary: Create the xl/workbook.xml file and associated relationship

member.param: If this worksheet needs an xl/worksheets/_rels/sheetX.xml.rels file

member.name: T:Simplexcel.XlsxInternal.XmlFile
member.summary: An XML File in the package
